content: लिंगिन् {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [लिंगमस्त्यस्य इनि] {@--1@} Having a mark or sign {@--2@} Characterized by. {@--3@} Wearing the marks or badges of, having the appearance of, disguised as, hypocritical, wearing false badges (at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>); स वर्णिलिंगी विदितः समाययौ युधिष्ठिरं द्वैतवने वनेचरः <ls>Ki. 1. 1</ls>; so आर्यलिंगिन्. {@--4@} Furnished with a {%linga%}. {@--5@} Having a right to wear signs or badges. {@--6@} One whose outward form corresponds with his inward character. {@--7@} Having a subtle body. {%--<ab>m.</ab>%} {@--1@} A religious student, Brāhmaṇa ascetic; <ls>Pt. 4. 39.</ls> {@--2@} A worshipper of Śiva's {%linga%}. {@--3@} A hypocrite, pretending devotee, pseudo-ascetic. {@--4@} An elephant. {@--5@} (In logic) That which possesses the {%linga%} or middle term; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} वह्नि is the लिंगिम् in the familiar instance पर्वतो वह्निमान् धूमात्. {@--6@} (Hence) The subject of a proposition. {@--7@} The supreme being (as the sustainer of {%linga%}.). {@--8@} The cause or source. {@--9@} <ab>N.</ab> of a Śaiva sect.
